description: This Python source file defines a custom error class 'AppError' with associated HTTP error handling methods, along with a function to generate standardized JSON error responses. It appears to be part of a backend API project, handling error semantics and responses.

classes.name: AppError
classes.description: A custom exception class representing application errors with associated HTTP response semantics.

methods.name: "AppError" bad_request(message: str, details: Any | None = None)
methods.description: Creates an AppError instance representing a 400 Bad Request error.

methods.name: "AppError" unauthorized(message: str, details: Any | None = None)
methods.description: Creates an AppError instance representing a 401 Unauthorized error.

methods.name: "AppError" forbidden(message: str, details: Any | None = None)
methods.description: Creates an AppError instance representing a 403 Forbidden error.

methods.name: "AppError" not_found(message: str, details: Any | None = None)
methods.description: Creates an AppError instance representing a 404 Not Found error.

methods.name: "AppError" conflict(message: str, details: Any | None = None)
methods.description: Creates an AppError instance representing a 409 Conflict error.

methods.name: "AppError" internal_server_error(message: str, details: Any | None = None)
methods.description: Creates an AppError instance representing a 500 Internal Server Error.

methods.name: JSONResponse error_response(err: AppError)
methods.description: Generates a JSONResponse with the error details from an AppError instance.

ctags.pattern: /^    def bad_request(message: str, details: Any | None = None) -> "AppError":$/
